title: Progress Software Kemp LoadMaster delcert Command Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of 	Progress Software Kemp LoadMaster. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the handling of user data passed to the delcert command. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied string before using it to execute a system call. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the bal user.
addtionnal_details: Progress Software has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://docs.progress.com/bundle/release-notes_loadmaster-7-2-62-2/page/Security-Updates.html
timeline:
2025-10-29 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2026-02-02 - Coordinated public release of advisory
2026-02-02 - Advisory Updated
credit: Alex Williams from Converge Technology Solutions
